thread.title: Kingshighway bridge closing Monday, will affect thousands of drivers
thread.title_full: Kingshighway bridge closing Monday, will affect thousands of drivers

author: Diana Barr
title: Kingshighway bridge closing Monday, will affect thousands of drivers
text: Kingshighway bridge closing Monday, will affect thousands of drivers Jul 6, 2015, 6:37am CDT Save Article A stretch of Kingshighway in St. Louis that carries more than 40,000 vehicles daily between south St. Louis and Interstate 44 or points farther north is closing for two years after rush hour Monday morning. A 75-year-old bridge on Kingshighway between Southwest/Vandeventer and Shaw Boulevard that spans Union Pacific Railroad tracks will undergo a $21 million reconstruction project. The work, funded by the Federal Highway Administration and Union Pacific Railroad, will be performed by contractor Kozeny-Wagner Inc. Construction will need to accommodate the railroad's schedule. Crews will close northbound Kingshighway about 10 a.m. Monday and final closure of the span will occur by 3 p.m. Detour signs will be posted. Southbound Kingshighway will be directed to use eastbound Shaw to Vandeventer; northbound Kingshighway drivers will use Vandeventer to westbound McRee. Cyclists should continue to use Macklind and Tower Grove avenues. Bizspace Spotlight
